isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

step1.para: Seat the outer races of the countershaft rear bearings only partially in the bores, just far enough to stay in place ( Figure 133).

figure.caption: Figure 133. Seat Outer Races of Countershaft Rear Bearings

step1.para: Place countershafts into position in the auxiliary housing, inserting the inner races into the partially installed outer races ( Figure 134).

important.para: As the countershafts are installed, mesh the marked low speed gear tooth on each countershaft between each set of marked gear teeth on the low speed gear.

step1.para: With the countershafts in position, complete the installation of the countershaft rear bearings on the shaft and into the case bore. Seat securely ( Figure 135).

figure.caption: Figure 135. Complete Installation of Countershaft Rear Bearings on Shaft

step1.para: Install the speedometer gear rear washer on the tailshaft and against the bearing, chamfered I.D. toward the bearing, and install the speedometer gear or replacement spacer on the shaft and against the washer ( Figure 136).

figure.caption: Figure 136. Install Speedometer Gear Rear Washer on Tailshaft

step1.para: If previously removed, install the oil seal in the rear bearing cover, lip of the seal to the rear.
Install the rear bearing cover with the speedometer bore up and to the left. Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N· m) ( Figure 137).
Install bearing on the front of the output shaft ( Figure 138).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Install Bearing on Front of Output Shaft
